intro: Patagonula americana var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy Patagonula, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, glandular leaves that are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Its inflorescence consists of yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Patagonula americana var. hirsuta is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
